abstract.para: &App; is a graphical frontend for FIBS, the First Internet Backgammon Server or other compatible servers.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &App; is a graphical frontend for &fibs;, the First Internet Backgammon Server or other compatible servers. You can play online against other players from all over the world.

SGF &App; uses the portable SGF format for saving files. This is the same format that GNU Backgammon GNU Backgammon uses. It is therefore easy for you to let GNU Backgammon analyse your matches after playing.

sect2.title: Gibbon on the Internet
sect2.para: You can find &app; on various places on the internet:

listitem.para: http://gibbon.guido-flohr.net is the official homepage of &app;.
On its Facebook page http://www.facebook.com/pages/Gibbon/201252806558402 you can follow &app; and keep informed about new releases or other information.
Its Ohloh page http://www.ohloh.net/projects/gibbon2 is targetted at people interested in the development and source code of &app;.

sect2.title: What does the name &App; mean?
sect2.para: It was one of the first words that came to my mind, when I thought about a name that resembles Guido, &fibs;, backgammon, ...

sect2.title: Does &fibs; Cheat?
sect2.para: After some research in various internet forums it is more than obvious that &fibs; cheats. It discriminates dice whiners! The internet is full of hard-luck stories that definetly prove it. Dice whiners dance for a dozen rounds on a two-point board, while their opponents get sequences of ridiculously lucky rolls. Another interesting "feature" of &fibs;' "random" number generator is that it gives significantly better rolls to the strong players, and the weak ones just don't have a chance to improve their game because of the bad numbers they roll. Isn't that unfair? Yes! But there is nothing that &app; can do about it.

sect2.title: Starting &app; from the application menu
sect2.para: Gnome If you use the Gnome desktop, you can start &app; from the Applications menu by selecting GamesGibbon. For other systems, &app; will be installed in a similar location.
